intro: Struthiola hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy struthiola, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Struthiola hirsuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
